ğŸŒ¾ Chapter 1 â€“ Food: Where Does It Come From?
ğŸ§© Introduction

Food is one of our basic needs. Every living being â€” humans, animals, and even tiny microorganisms â€” needs food to live and grow.
Food gives us energy, helps us grow, repair body parts, and keeps us healthy.

ğŸŒ± 1.1 â€“ What Do We Eat?

We eat different kinds of food every day â€” rice, chapati, dal, fruits, vegetables, milk, etc.
These foods are made from various ingredients.
For example:

Idli â†’ made from rice and urad dal.

Roti â†’ made from wheat flour and water.

Vegetable curry â†’ made from vegetables, salt, spices, and oil.

â¡ï¸ Ingredients are the materials used to prepare a dish.

ğŸ¥• 1.2 â€“ Sources of Food

All food comes from plants or animals.

ğŸŒ¿ Plant Sources

Cereals: Wheat, rice, maize

Pulses: Gram, lentil, beans

Vegetables & Fruits: Tomato, mango, spinach

Oil seeds: Mustard, groundnut, sunflower

ğŸ„ Animal Sources

Milk: Cow, buffalo, goat

Eggs: Hen, duck

Meat & Fish: Goat, chicken, fish

ğŸŒ¾ 1.3 â€“ Plant Parts and Animal Products as Food

We eat different parts of plants:

Plant Part	Examples
Roots	Carrot, beetroot, radish
Stems	Potato, sugarcane
Leaves	Spinach, lettuce
Flowers	Cauliflower, banana flower
Fruits	Apple, mango, tomato
Seeds	Wheat, rice, pulses

ğŸ’¡ Interesting Fact:
Sometimes we eat more than one part of a plant.
Example â†’ Mustard plant:

Seeds â†’ give oil

Leaves â†’ used as vegetable

ğŸ” 1.4 â€“ What Do Animals Eat?

Different animals eat different types of food.
Based on their eating habits, animals are classified as:

Type of Animal	Food Type	Examples
Herbivores	Eat only plants	Cow, goat, rabbit
Carnivores	Eat other animals	Lion, tiger, snake
Omnivores	Eat both plants and animals	Humans, dog, crow
ğŸ” 1.5 â€“ Food Variety

Food habits vary from place to place depending on:

Availability of ingredients

Climate

Culture or traditions

Example:
In South India â†’ rice and coconut are common.
In North India â†’ wheat, pulses, and dairy products are popular.

ğŸ’¬ Summary

Food gives energy and helps in growth.

We get food from plants and animals.

We eat different parts of plants.

Animals are herbivores, carnivores, or omnivores.

Food habits vary in different regions.

ğŸ§  Keywords

Ingredients â€“ Materials used to make food

Sources of food â€“ Plants and animals that give us food

Herbivore â€“ Plant-eating animal

Carnivore â€“ Flesh-eating animal

Omnivore â€“ Animal eating both plants and animals

ğŸ“ Question & Answers

Q1. Name five plant-based food items that you eat.
Ans: Rice, wheat, tomato, spinach, mango.

Q2. Name any three animals which provide us food.
Ans: Cow (milk), Hen (eggs), Goat (meat).

Q3. Name the parts of a plant that we eat as food.
Ans: Roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, seeds.

Q4. What are herbivores? Give two examples.
Ans: Animals that eat only plants are called herbivores.
Examples: Cow, goat.

Q5. Write two examples each of plant and animal sources of food.
Ans:

Plant sources: Wheat, rice

Animal sources: Milk, eggs

Q6. Why do we need food?
Ans: We need food to get energy, to grow, and to repair body parts.

Q7. Can you name one plant whose root and leaves are both edible?
Ans: Beetroot â€” we eat its root as vegetable and leaves as salad.

A. Very Short Answer Questions

Q1. What are the two main sources of food?
Ans: The two main sources of food are plants and animals.

Q2. What do we get from plants?
Ans: We get cereals, pulses, fruits, vegetables, and oils from plants.

Q3. What do we get from animals?
Ans: We get milk, eggs, and meat from animals.

Q4. Name any two food items prepared from milk.
Ans: Butter and curd.

Q5. Which part of the carrot plant do we eat?
Ans: We eat the root of the carrot plant.

Q6. What are ingredients?
Ans: Ingredients are the materials used to prepare food.

Q7. Which part of the mustard plant gives oil?
Ans: Mustard seeds give us oil.

Q8. Name any one food item that contains more than one ingredient.
Ans: Dal curry â€“ made with dal, water, salt, and spices.

Q9. What type of food does a lion eat?
Ans: Lion eats meat, so it is a carnivore.

Q10. Name one omnivore animal.
Ans: Humans are omnivores.

ğŸ› B. Short Answer Questions

Q1. What are the advantages of eating food?
Ans:

It gives us energy for work and play.

It helps us grow and develop.

It helps to repair damaged body parts.

It keeps us healthy and strong.

Q2. What are the different parts of plants we eat as food? Give examples.
Ans:
We eat different parts of plants such as:

Roots â†’ Carrot, beetroot

Stems â†’ Potato, sugarcane

Leaves â†’ Spinach, cabbage

Flowers â†’ Cauliflower, banana flower

Fruits â†’ Mango, apple

Seeds â†’ Wheat, rice

Q3. Differentiate between herbivores, carnivores, and omnivores.

Type	Food	Example
Herbivores	Eat only plants	Cow, goat, rabbit
Carnivores	Eat only meat	Lion, tiger
Omnivores	Eat both plants and animals	Humans, dog

Q4. Why do different regions of India have different food habits?
Ans:
Different regions have different climates, soil types, and availability of crops, which lead to different food habits. For example, people in coastal areas eat fish and rice, while people in northern India eat wheat and dairy products.

Q5. Write a short note on animal-based food.
Ans:
Animals give us various food products such as milk, meat, fish, and eggs.
Milk and its products like curd, butter, and cheese are important for our diet.

ğŸ§© C. Long Answer Questions

Q1. Explain with examples the different parts of a plant that we eat.
Ans:
We eat different parts of a plant:

Roots: Carrot, radish, turnip

Stem: Potato, sugarcane

Leaves: Spinach, lettuce

Flower: Cauliflower, broccoli

Fruits: Mango, banana, tomato

Seeds: Wheat, rice, pulses
Some plants have more than one edible part â€” e.g., Mustard (leaves and seeds).

Q2. How do we get food from animals? Give examples.
Ans:
Animals provide food in many ways:

Milk: From cows, buffaloes, goats (used to make curd, butter, ghee).

Eggs: From hens and ducks.

Meat: From chicken, fish, goat, and pigs.
Thus, animals are an important source of protein-rich food.

Q3. Why do we eat a variety of food items?
Ans:
Our body needs different nutrients like carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals. No single food can provide all nutrients, so we must eat a variety of food items for a balanced diet and good health.

Q4. Explain the relationship between food, ingredients, and sources.
Ans:
Every food item is made from one or more ingredients.
Each ingredient is obtained from a source â€” either plant or animal.
Example:

Roti â†’ made from wheat (plant source)

Milkshake â†’ made from milk (animal source) and fruits (plant source)

So, ingredients come from sources, and together they form the food we eat.

ğŸ’¡ D. Think and Answer (Higher Order)

Q1. You are given a salad of carrot, beetroot, and tomato. Which parts of plants are you eating?
Ans:

Carrot â†’ Root

Beetroot â†’ Root

Tomato â†’ Fruit

Q2. If all animals stopped eating plants, what would happen?
Ans:
If animals stopped eating plants, herbivores would die, then carnivores (which depend on herbivores) would also die. The entire food chain would collapse.

Q3. Why is it important to protect both plants and animals?
Ans:
Both are important sources of food. If plants or animals disappear, we will not have enough food to survive. They also maintain ecological balance.

Q4. A student prepared fruit salad using apple, banana, and mango. From where did she get these ingredients?
Ans:
All these ingredients â€” apple, banana, and mango â€” come from plants (fruits).

Q5. Name one food item that can be eaten raw and cooked both.
Ans:
Carrot can be eaten raw as salad and also cooked as a vegetable.
